verses.roman:
tathāvadad guḍākeśo
vāsudevāya so 'pi tām
ratham āropya tad-vidvān
dharma-rājam upāgamat

synonyms: tathā—thus; avadat—said; guḍākeśaḥ—Arjuna; vāsudevāya—to Lord Kṛṣṇa; saḥ—He; api—and; tām—her; ratham—on His chariot; āropya—taking up; tat—of all this; vidvān—already aware; dharma-rājam—to King Yudhiṣṭhira; upāgamat—He went.
translation: [Śukadeva Gosvāmī continued:] Arjuna repeated all this to Lord Vāsudeva, who was already aware of it. The Lord then took Kālindī onto His chariot and went back to see King Yudhiṣṭhira.
